Let's finish off class 10 with a "pipeline" for comparative structure analysis.

```{r}
library(bio3d)
```

```{r}
id <- "1ake_A"

aa <- get.seq(id)

aa
```

Let's search for related sequences in the PDB database

```{r}
blast <- blast.pdb(aa)
```
Plot an overview of my search results

```{r}
hits <- plot(blast)
```

Let's see what the "top hits" are:

```{r}
hits$pdb.id
```
We can download all of these PDBs to the `path="pdbs"` folder with the `get.pdb()` function:

```{r}
files <- get.pdb(hits$pdb.id, path="pdbs", split=TRUE, gzip=TRUE)
```

```{r}
# Align releated PDBs
pdbs <- pdbaln(files, fit = TRUE, exefile="msa")
```
## Conventional analysis

An RMSD analysis and heatmap:
```{r}
rd <- rmsd(pdbs)
```
```{r}
library(pheatmap)
pheatmap(rd)
```
```{r}
source("https://tinyurl.com/newviewngl")
library(NGLVieweR)
```
```{r}
view.pdbs(pdbs)
```
We can cluster by RMSD and then color our structure display

```{r}
km <- kmeans(rd, centers=2)
mycols <- c("red", "blue")[km$cluster]
```

```{r}
view.pdbs(pdbs, colors = mycols)
```
## Principal Component Analysis

```{r}
pc <- pca(pdbs)
plot(pc, col=mycols)
```

```{r}
mktrj(pc, file="pca.pdb")
```

```{r}
p <- read.pdb("pca.pdb", multi =T)
view.pdb(p)
```
```{r}
ref <- read.pdb("1ake")
view.pdb(ref)
```
